I loved the zigeuner schnitzel, red cabbage was great and the fritten were out of this world. I had a draft pilsner. If you are out in the East Valley, this would be a great place to entertain friends or take your girl for a date.

What a find! We learned of Zur Kate, an authentic German restaurant, from friends and dined there this week. The food was fantastic and exactly what you would expect - sausages, schnitzel, kraut, potatoes, spaetzle, rye, and much more. They have live German music to set the mood. Daily specials, too. Our party of four all had different entries and all were superb. The home made signature sausages are the best we've had.

We went on a Friday with a group of friends.  We waited about 25 minutes before being seated.  This place was packed with a wait list over 45 minutes by the time we left.   This was our first visit, but our friends know the owner and have been several times before.  I was told everything is good which I trusted based on how busy it was.  I ordered the Friday night special, which was rouladan.  It was delicious.  The beef was tender and exploding with flavour.  The red cabbage was a little crunchy, (yum) the home fries were delicious, especially slathered in gravy.  My kid ordered a hot dog.  He liked it, which is good because in general he doesn't like anything.  I do kind of feel bad that we went without my husband, whom was born in Germany and hasn't had German food in years, but he was fortunate enough at the time to be stuck in Lviv so he was getting some good eats in out there...    The price is very inexpensive considering the amount of food you get.  The decor is tasteful and has a family feel to it.  The seating is tight but I can totally understand wanting to use every possible space to get more people in. I can't wait to go again soon, but this time take my husband.

Based on yelp reviews, went for the first time. Enjoyable. My wife had the haus bratwurst & enjoyed it.  I had the Jager Schnitzel with sauerkraut & spaetzle. Tasty.      Spaetzle was very tiny. I prefer thicker spaetzle.  Accordion player accompanied our meal. The draft Warsteiner Dunkel was delicious. Wife had S glass of Zeller Scwartz Kay. I had a curry bratwurst as a side in a delicious sauce. Service was friendly & prompt. I liked the food, beer & atmosphere. I will be a repeat customer. Wierd that Bavarian Point German restaurant is in the same strip mall but neither name is on the marquee. Give it a try.

This is the second time I've been here and the food is not really German, sauerkraut and sausages anybody can do, and there's schnitzel is not too hot either, this time I ordered a beer in my food and ordered a glass of water which I never got I asked twice,they put a few German signs inside thereand call it a German restaurant!! The snowbirds and old codgers a go there don't know German food from African food believe me!! Never again the best German restaurants in Glendale Hans !! 100 Times better,at least you get a glass of water with ice when you asked for it!!

This place is absolutely wonderful!!!! My friends and I went here to celebrate a birthday party . I never felt so welcomed at a restaurant, the company of the servers the jokes being passed around was so amazing I felt like family here ! The food was amazing the beer let me tell you about the beer the best German beer my lips have ever drank . I will defiantly come back and tell others about the wonderful service and the wonderful companionship of this restaurant!  Two thumbs up!!!!

Zur Kate is an excellent German Restaurant. We went on a Saturday when they opened at 4 PM. Within a few minutes all the booths in the restaurant were full. The wait staff hustled to make sure everyone had menus and drinks. A few minutes later we had our drinks and a basket of marble rye bread that was delicious. We placed our orders after asking a few questions about the menu of German specialties. Our food came a short time later delivered by the owner. Each table in the restaurant received their food quickly as well. The food was excellent. Two of us had the Jager schnitzel, one had the goulash and one had the schnitzel with onions. Each dinner came with a starch side (spetzel or German potato salad at our table) and your choice of sauerkraut or red cabbage. The sides were as good as the entrees. Zur Kate also has German beer on tap which was served in the appropriate glasses. Overall we had a fantastic experience and meal.

Coming from Austria I was really lookng forward to good Wienerschnitzel and good German potato salad. Bothl were very disappointing. The schnitzel was dry and the breading used was not authentic. Potato salad was watery.  The service was good and friendly and the prices are reasonable- and the german beer is great.  The ambiance is very authentic, too bad the food was so disappointing.

Great service and wenn du Deutsch sprichts...besser. The owner was around and over heard our compliments and in the end we had a complimentary round of apfelschaps. If you have never been to Germany this will be a real close experience (decoration and music). Food is more Hamburg style.   If you know how is food in Germany this place will be an ok for you, but still puts you in the mood to sing a lied!

Huge line to get in at 5:30 on a Saturday night (they open at 4).  Unclear service arrangements, small menu, accordeon player.  Located in a small mall not far from the other German restaurant in Mesa.  Not Germany but an ok substitute.

The place was packed! We got there only 5 minutes after the restaurant was opened on Saturday, and we got the last available table. Those who came after us had to put their name on the list and wait.  The food is so good and the service was great. They were so nice and dressed in the traditional outfits. The food came out fast and we finished the whole plate. The rye bread were fresh and delicious. We don't need to put any butter on.  I had Jager Schnitzel with red cabbage and Spaetzle. Usually it is hard for me to find the gravy I like, but this place has the best gravy. Since it was First Saturday, it seems like everyone ordered a baked hamhock (pork shank). Next time I need to try this menu.
My favorite place to eat! This time i tried the rib plate, so tender and full of flavor,  amazing!

We arrived just on the verge of dinner rush hour. Had to wait for a couple to leave and was wondering why with a long table had 6 empty places. Though the waiter would at least asked if we minded sharing a table, later on I saw why. The whole table must be reserved for regulars because after we were seated and had ordered, a couple came in and went directly to the empty seats. About 10 - 15 minutes later, 4 more people came in and took the 4 other empty places. Once we were seated, the service was prompt and helpful. The marble rye was  great. The beer cold and tasty. The food, not so good or traditional.  I wanted very much to give this restaurant a 5 but I'm sorry I just can't bring myself to even a 4. The sauerkraut was sweet!  I might be wrong, but it's sauerkraut supposed to be sour? Red cabbage was sweet! My wife's dumpling was pasty and did I mention that both the sauerkraut and red cabbage was SWEET? Best I can say, it was almost OK and this is now on my "Been there, Done that" list

My friends and I decided to try out Zur Kate because we were looking for something new to try.  We're a group of late 20 and early 30 year olds and usually end up at some chain restaurant in Tempe or Scottsdale to eat. If you are looking for authentic German food then you will find it at Zur Kate. It wasn't GREAT German food but it was GOOD.   I was super-excited when I found out the daily special (Friday) was Rouladen because this was one of my favorite meals that my mom used to make for us (she's from Germany). So that's what I ended up getting. The verdict -- it was good but my mother's (and mine) is way better. It tasted a little over cooked and could've used more of the traditional ingredients stuffed in it. I also ordered sauerkraut and potato dumpling. The sauerkraut was a little bland but stll good. The potato dumpling was my favorite item on my plate. Nice big dumpling ball, perfect consistancy with the traditional crouton in the center.   I must add that we sat down and ordered our food around 6:30 - 7:00pm and I almost didn't get the rouladen. It was the last one they had.  So people must love it.  The rest of our table ordered either one of the schnitzel or brat plates. They all seemed pretty happy with their selections and I tried a bite of a couple of them and they had good flavor.  One thing I didn't like is that NONE of the schnitzels were veal...all were pork. It would've been nice to have more than one option.   The staff was super busy (they probably could've used another server or two). Our server was a german woman who was good but you could tell she was rushed. She actually forgot to put my food order in so I received my food about 5 mins after the rest of the table.  The place could use a good sprucing. There were cute nicknacks on the walls but is defnitely could use some updating. I think if they were located in a larger space it would be better. There was an accordian player that played all throughout dinner and he was very good and it helped add to the ambiance.  On a side note, there was about 80 people in the restaurant (which is kind of small) and I think everyone except for my friends and I were all over the age of 70. I think a lot of old timers like this place.  Not that there's anything wrong with this, it was just a little funny. We did get to the restaurant kind of early though...6:15pm ish.  All in all, it was a good experience and I would definitely go back, just maybe at a later time in the night when the early bird rush is gone so it's not as busy.  The End...

We set out to find Bavarian Point restaurant and stumbled into Zur-Kate by accident.  They are next door to each other, although I had never heard of Zur-Kate before.  What a stroke of luck.  The atmosphere was very cozy with lots of German flair.  The place was very crowded at 8pm, and everyone seemed to be having a very god time.  The first thing we noticed about the menu was the far lower prices than the ones on menus we had seen on line for other Valley German restaurants.  Many different kinds of wurst, schitzel and chops are available to choose from.  Each entree comes with a choice of German potato salad, spatzel, potato cake, home fries or french fries.  You also receive your choice of sauerkraut or red cabbage.  A salad bar is included, and basket of rye bread delivered to the table.  There is not an entree on the menu over $12, and you can add a wurst to any entree for $2.50.  Beers are in the $2-$4 range - where does that happen?  These prices are already amazing, but then you see the portion sizes.  The schnitzels are huge, and each comes with a generous portion of side.  I had the Rhein Schitzel - juicy pork, lightly breaded and fried until golden bown and crisp, topped with sauteed onions and a sour-cream based light gravy.  It was fantastic.  Very well seasoned, light, not greasy and absolutley huge.  Add in the red cabbage and spatezel and you have a formidable meal.  I added a knockwurst just to try it, and there was no way that I could finish my dinner.  Everyone at my table felt the same about their meals.  This place is a gem and should not be missed.  I really cannot imagine what more you could want out of a German restaurant, except maybe higher prices.  Im sure the other restaurants in town are also good, but we cant wait to go back to Zur Kate.
Terrific authentic German food. Can't beat the sausages and brats. Spaezle is authentic too.

Zur Kate is unique to the area (well, except for the Bavarian restaurant in the same plaza) and offers some really great food. I love coming here for the comfort food and the quality has never disappointed. I love their Black Forest cake, too!

We came here for my dad's retirement get together (he's friends with the owner) and it was pretty dang good. I only ate off of my parents plates since I wasn't very hungry, but the cabbage was so good. I don't remember exactly what either of them got, but it was so good; I wish I had been hungrier. The apple schnapps were to die for.

The food is great! Too many schnitzels to choose from and every one I have had is great. Try the rouladen if you happen to go when it's a special, it is amazing! Service is good and the portions are too big to eat in one sitting, you will be taking some home. Nice selection of imported German beer, so don't expect to get a domestic brew.

My wife and I tried this place for the first time tonight. The food, service and price were all fantastic!  The food was real, authentic recipes from Germany. Everything tasted perfect and the serving sizes were more than generous. Will be coming back often for, hopefully, many years to come.
Best German food in town, live music on Fridays. The customer service is really great here. They make you feel at home.

Zur Kate 4815 E Main St Mesa, AZ  85205  Five of us met at Zur Kate for a German dinner. The owner is from Germany, and we were looking forward to some real German food. For two of us, it started with 30 ounce steins of Warsteiner Dunkel beer. Dark, cold, and very satisfying. Live accordion playing was taking place in the room next to us, and we soon found ourselves toe tapping to the music.  Fresh rye bread was brought to the table. It was soft and delicious, though I would have enjoyed it more if it had been just a bit warm.  Our waitress was friendly and efficient. I ordered the Jagerschnitzel with spaetzle and a side of curry wurst. Companion 1 ordered the exact same dish, while companion 2 ordered the Leberkase with gravy. Companion 3 ordered the curry wurst with home fries and companion 4 ordered the zwiebel rippchen which is a smoked pork chop with grilled onions.  With the exception of companion 2, everyone enjoyed their dishes and were totally stuffed.  Companion 2 felt that the food needed more seasoning and was a bit dry. Then again, Leberkase is a finely ground sausage loaf that can easily be a bit on the dryer side because the meat is chopped so fine.  I got to taste companion 4's pork chop and it was absolutely delicious as well as mouth wateringly tender.  For dessert, I ordered the apple strudel and was unable to finish it because I was so full. Companion 1, 3 and 4 all ordered the Black Forest cake and pronounced it wonderful. (It had a touch of booze in it which may have caused them to say that)! Unfortunately, they were sold out of the cheese cake for the evening.  When the bill came I initially thought there must have been a mistake because the bill was so low and we ate so much, but reviewing it showed no mistake. The food was quite reasonable, especially since I would have liked a wheel barrow to get out the door.  The only fault I could find was that it was fairly warm inside. Even with the door open, the temperature was a bit too warm. A bit of air conditioning would have been really helpful.  Since every table was taken it was a bit noisy inside, but in truth, most German restaurants are not exactly quiet and they usually have an atmosphere of conviviality and fun.  Everything was clean, and service was as expected.  4 stars for good food, good atmosphere, and cleanliness.

We stumbled onto this place and it was AMAZING.  Everything was tired was unbelievable. This place is a hidden gem, and the service for a place this busy is outstanding. This will become a regular for us.

I'm a bit surprised by the rating that this restaurant receives. Service, and ambience, are great in this restaurant. However the food is subpar, cafeteria at best . everything tasted as if it had been microwaved. The Spätzle did not taste anything like Spätzle  , and the sauerkraut seemed to have been purchased at Big Lots, which I do as well, but then I also cook it for another hour or so to get the flavor to what it needs to be. Also, all the schnitzels that we ordered were soggy,  so obviously thrown into microwave.  Lol. I wouldn't recommend this to any Germans, but if you are American and don't know what German food tastes like, than this might be something to try out...? As said, German ambiance is definitely the best part in this restaurant. Stay away from the food and have a beer instead.

My wife and I dined last night at this little gem of a restaurant in Mesa.  We both wanted the same entree (Jagerschnitzel), but at least chose different sides with our meals.  The schnitzel was perfectly prepared, with very light breading.  The mushroom sauce was delicious.  My wife had the red cabbage and the spatzle, and eaved about both (I snuck a taste, too, and have to agree!).  I enjoyed sauerkraut (among the best I've ever had), and German potato salad.  The potato salad, was fine, but did not impress me as much as the rest of the meal.  We did not have dessert.  The service, was slow (thus 4 stars instead of 5), but this place definitely deserves a visit.

We've been looking for a good German restaurant for years. And we found it in Mesa. AZ. We got here early when they opened and there was a line. Our waitress was a hoot. Even with a party of 16 sitting down when we did the service was fast and impeccable. And OMG the food was great. I had Bratwurst with a curry sauce. My husband had the Cordon Blue Schnitzel. Sides were red cabbage,sauerkraut, and German potatoes salad. All excellent.  Black Forest Cake went home with us. This place is way out but well worth the drive.  We'll definitely come back.
Very good German food.  We had a party of 15 and they had excellent service. On weekends they have a live accordian player.

Went to Zur Kate last Friday evening. We got seated within 5 minutes..lucky I guess since this restaurant has good reviews. I recommended to my wife any of the schnitzels while I ordered the pork roast (special that evening).   My food was very good but I kicked myself afterwards for not following my own recommendation.  The Rahm schnitzel was to die for...absolutely amazing. My taste buds were very happy when my wife gave me 2 bites  of her plate. Order with the spaetzle and red cabbage and you will be happy.  We ended with the Apple Struddle and cheesecake..fantastic...although the Struddle  was a little bit soggy for our taste. - Service was excellent..decor and atmosphere felt relaxing and homey.  I will go back there for sure.

Authentic German Food!  The best part was that I was in the company of 2 German dudes!  Thanks to a great host who was a regular at this place,  we had the best service with the drinks flowing at just the right times.  Bratwurst and schnitzel with all the fixings was nice and savory.  The portions are generous and most importantly the service is friendly and dressed like in the German Costumes.   Thanks for inspiring our family to take a trip to Germany! Come to place to enjoy great German food!

First time here and it's a small homey place.  The food was delicious!   Service is excellent!  Not a large selection of beer/liquor choices but still good German beer and the home made schnapps is beyond smooth.   We had the schnitzel which was yummy!   I tried the spaetzle and it was amazing.  Hubby had the fries and I had to steal some because they are delicious.  Really relaxed and fun atmosphere.   We are going back to try the sausage menu!

I have lived near this place for a few years and I have not had food this good since I lived in Germany. The decorations are a little bit over the top, but the food is as authentic as it gets!  Sauerbraten was excellent as was the Jägerschnitzel. The atmosphere was awesome. A lone accordionist played for about 45 minutes (started right after we got there and finished right before we left). The music the perfect accompaniment for dinner.  The prices are amazingly low and the portions are huge. I am looking forward to returning again very soon. I can't recommend this place enough!

My first time eating here.  I love German food and this was quite good.  The Cornish hen was cooked to order for my wife, the sausage were flavorful, the kraut delicious.  The atmosphere is also great.  The accordion music was enjoyable but not too overpowering.  The beer tasty.  My wife an I are excited to come back and explore the menu further.  The staff were super friendly.  If this seems a little rambling did I mention the beer was tasty!
Outstanding authentic german restaurant. Love the schnitzel and red kraut. Always a good time at a great price.
I have dined 100's of times in Bavaria and I can attest that this place is just like being there! Be there early and expect a wait but it is well worth it!  Fantastic place and fabulous German food.

Great atmosphere and the owner is a blast.    I had the rahm schnitzel.  I was disappointed because it was breaded, and it was pork.  Looked the same schnitzel they use for all of them just with different sauces.  Pretty sure it's frozen and not hand made.    The cream sauce was bland but passable, it didn't have any good wine flavor, nor did it have any mushrooms.  Looked like a simple gravy with a shot of their Jaeger sauce for pop.  It was just weird.  But it tasted good, just not like I make it or I've had it Germany.  Could be a north-south thing since I lived in southern Germany.    Anyway, i would give it 3.5 if I could.   It's a fun little taste of Germany that brought back some great memories.  I'll be going back when the rolanden is on special.

My group of friends and I go to dinner here at least 2 times a month. The waitresses recognized us after the first time being there and remember our beer orders! The food comes out hot and tastes great every time! Can't wait to keep going back!
Bodenständige Deutsche Küche, Mesa ist kulinarisch mit der Kate das Bayern Arizonas. Moderate Preise und König Ludwig für die Kehle. Die Schlembachs hams einfach drauf. Volle Punktzahl für die Kate!

Yummy and Fun!  I was meeting friends who were in town for the night and they picked this place because it was close to their hotel. Wow, we didn't know what a treat we were in for. Besides the charming German decor, they had a husband/wife team  playing accordion and singing German songs. The duo even stopped at our table and played a couple of kid's songs for my friends' little girl.  The food was great - we got 2 versions of the schnitzel - cordon bleu and one that had traditional gravy but with a hint of hot peppers in it. Yum! Our third adult diner got the sauerbraten which was tender and juicy. The sides, German Potato Salad and Spaetzle as well as sauerkraut and cooked shredded cabbage and the delicious rye bread made great meal. The kiddo's burger must have been good, too, because she cleaned her plate. We then split a black forest cake and a strudel, both of which were yum.   For drinks, we split a pitcher of oktoberfest beer, which had just the right hint of spice.  This is a very small place, so even though we did not have to wait for a table, I could see that happening, especially if your group was more than 4 people.  Definitely will recommend and will return when we want another German food fix.  Prost!

Love this place. But it was not that good last time we went. It was pork special night. Food were extremely cold and tough to chew the pork. Potato dumbling used to very chewy but it was not chewy at all..

My mother was born in Germany and my Oma, was from a small town near Cologne. She raised me and is still my best friend to this very day! Never being out in east Mesa, I have been dying to try this place for over a year! Luckily, I was forced to work in Mesa today and I didn't mind one bit! Immediately the smells drew me in as I walked through the front. It took me back to the Oktoberfest days with the German air force used to host and I attended since birth! The music, reminded me of home and my childhood. The smells, reminded me of my Omi's kitchen. I ordered to-go for me and my husband. It was impossible to choose and I stared at other people's food as they were eating! They served every single beer I grew up drinking, I was entirely impressed! It was packed and rightfully so. I waited a decent amount for my food outside but I understand completely. The Spätzle, knockwurst, and red cabbage were to die for! Of course, food never tastes as good as your grandmother makes it! This place touched a special place in my heart and the food warmed my soul! I will be visiting here more frequently, PROST!!!!

Have tried this place a few times.   We have grown to expect a wait and plan accordingly.   The food has always been good and delivered quickly.   Their bread is served warm and is delicious.   We don't often order desserts, but they are so good here we always do.

Good German food and beer although the beer choices were pretty much the larger German Beer companies.  A couple of local places, Four Peaks and Huss both make excellent Kolsch beers that would do well on the menu here to have some fresh beer.  My only complaint about the food is that mine was drenched in gravy and my apple strudel was also swimming in the vanilla sauce )not that it was bad but just a little too much and the salad bar was pretty minimal,

Pretty good German fare (good sausage and schnitzel, the gravy was a little bland, but this is German food) and a pretty fun environment on the weekend (the accordion player really gets the snowbirds going, especially when he plays Edelweiss).  Friendly service.

I have been going here for years. I always thought that the decor was a little much but when we were visiting my wife's parents in Bavaria I found a place that I would swear is the twin of Zur Kate. I think the food is spot on for a German restaurant. The staff is always friendly. Jager schnitzel and Rahm schnitzel are my favorites. The menu is very typical of a small restaurant in Germany as is the beer selection...both are limited in options but generous in size for the price. The atmosphere is what it is all about and they have that part down.
How have I not heard of this place sooner? I love the exterior, the interior had a cozy German feel to it and the food is amazing. Definitely my new go-to restaurant in the east valley!

We gave Zur Kate 2 stars only because the meals were edible (barely). When we called in our pick-up order, we expressly stated that we normally go to Bavarian Point and this would be the very 1st time trying Zur Kate.  Big Mistake - HUGE Mistake (...and THIS disgusting mess was to be my wife's birthday dinner).  1.   The weiner schnitzels were dry & the meat had NO flavor - totally devoid of moisture. 2.   The home fries ...well, that's a misnomer.  THESE were NOT home fries, but more like what was left in the pan after all the home fries were served to others.  They appeared to be the leavings - dark, overcooked, very small pieces.  NOT flat full slices of potato. 3.   The spätzle was soggy, mushy & covered with the most unappealing gravy; so soggy & mushy that we could've drank them. 4.   The sauerkraut was nothing special either, with no texture; overcooked. 5.   The only positive was the red cabbage - which was delicious.  We should have ordered from Bavarian Point ...and we will from now on. Do yourselves a favor & go to Bavarian Point, so you can compare too (and don't forget to order their outstanding Goulash Soup!)  Disclaimer: The name shown on this account is not my actual name.

As a lover of all things German, I spotted this place while first trying the neighboring Bavarian Point restaurant. I made a mental note to return to this same shopping center to visit Zur Kate. The opportunity arose when my roommate and I found ourselves exploring the nooks and crannies of the East Valley. As we were famished from wandering around without a real destination, this place immediately inspired us.  Although it was five minutes until closing, we were welcomed into the restaurant by the owner and staff. We sat at the bar and enjoyed great conversation (along with our rye bread and Warsteiner beers). My roomie and I ordered the Rouladen (special for that weekend) and the Zigeuner Schnitzel. The rouladen was perfect: the beef was fall-apart tender and the filling was accented with the bacon and delicious. The zigeuner schnitzel was also quite good with a crispy breading and a slightly spicy pepper sauce. I was not impressed with the spaetzle (although I confess I can be a bit of a snob in this area, since I own my own spaetzle grater), however, the sauerkraut and the red cabbage were delicious.  We really enjoyed the laid-back friendly atmosphere of this place. The highlight (besides the fabulous German fare) was getting to know the owner, Horst, who convinced us to extend our visit with multiple rounds of Apple Schnapps. Truly a great dining experience!  We will return to Zur Kate, to try their weekend special of Schweinehaxe (1st Friday & Saturday of the month). I'm dying to sample their Bratkartoffeln (home-fried potatoes) as I have fond memories of these from my past days living in Germany.  Go to Zur Kate for the food... but stay for the gemütlichkeit (coziness)!

It's so hard to find good German food but this place does it right!! German owned and you can tell. The place is small but I enjoyed that. They handle the traffic (full on a Tuesday evening) well considering the space. You won't regret a visit. The food is worth any short wait you may experience.

Ill try not to talk it up too much but I have to say it was one of the best dinning experiences I've ever had. My wife and I stopped in and were really surprised on how authentic the inside of the restaurant looked. The meal was perfect and the service was out of this world friendly. Even the owner took time to sit and talk with us and share stories.  I thought places like this only existed in movies. Thanks Zur Kate for the good time and we are looking forward to visiting your fine establishment again!!!
Terribly disappointing! The hamburger from the one undaring person was the best thing in the menu. If you want want true, good authentic German food, look elsewhere.

As a Dutchman I'm quickly won over by the old world charm of Zur Kate, but don't think I wouldn't praise the food if praise wasn't due, it is very good (just like home). The service is fast and friendly, and they carry a small but excellent selection of import beers. Can definitely take the whole family here, there's something for everyone. Sometimes they provide live music as well. The handlebar-mustache donning owner is a great host! :)

If you are looking for a new, exciting, cultural experience, and home cooked feel all in one, this is the place to go!   I grew up in Germany, and Zur Kate is beyond fantastic.  With it's traditional polka accordion player and it's nostalgic home feel decorum, combined with the extremely well prepared food, authentic German beers, and astoundingly great service, I have to give them 5 stars!

Amazing food, great service and the beer flows like water! Highly recommended.  We had the Jager Schnitzel with Spätzel and Red Cabbage. The schnitzel was as tender as buttered and the gravy was to die for. Spätzle was tender and buttery.  We also had a currywurst which also amazingly good and served with a sizeable portion of sourkraut.   Will definitely be back!!

My wife and I went on a Friday night.  There was a 45 minute wait which is to be expected.  No pager given.  Just instructions to wait outside.  This restaurant is next door to a Smoke shop.  There were inconsiderate smokers outside which made it an unpleasant wait.  We walked in and saw an accordion player which was nice.  Once seated, we noticed that the menu doesn't have appetizers.  They serve 3 slices of rye bread with butter as an appetizer.  There aren't sampler plates on the menu either.  Server told us that they were out of ham hocks.  Prices were very reasonable.    Wife ordered Bratwursts and I got Wiener schnitzel.  Both were good, but not large plates.  I would have preferred to pay a little more for a larger serving.  For dessert, we shared an apple strudel which was great.  My wife is a huge fan of Haus Murphy and wasn't as happy with this place.  We did notice another German restaurant a few doors down called Bavarian Point.  It has slightly less stars than this place.

Zur Kate is a real treat - the atmosphere feel's like your dining in a traditional German pub. The staff are very accommodating to folks unfamiliar with German fare. We loved every bite and managed to eat about half of our massive portions. An accordion player started playing as we were leaving around 7:30pm. The place has some real history if you read the story on the menu. We will return!!!

So good!! We waited 2 hours for this gem and it was worth it! My husband ordered the ham hocks and I ordered the Schnitzel. It was our first time there. We also loved the musician; felt so authentic. We will definitely go again but will go a lot earlier to beat the crowds.

We had a wonderful dinner and drinks at Zur Kate. Both of us had sausages. Mine was smoked polish sausage. Just perfect. I added red cabbage and potatoes. Generous portions and delicious. Riesling wine was very good. The accordion player added to traditional German atmosphere.  Servers are friendly and do a great job in a very popular venue. Get there early on weekends or be prepared for a wait. However it is worth it.

My family and I had a wonderful time this weekend at  Zur Kate . The atmosphere of this place is welcoming! There was a man playing German music on his accordion which was really nice. The waitress was very friendly as she took are drink and food orders . The food is delicious and the portions are generous! The price are great for the amount of food you get here. I must say the Zur Kate is more like going to someone's home for a good ole home cooked meal and not going to a restaurant. I highly recommend this place to anyone! I will be back again soon!

We have been to Zur Kate twice in the past two years. We would go many more times if it weren't for the 30 plus minute drive to the restaurant for us. After the first time we were so impressed we knew that we must go back. If you want authentic German food you must go to Zur Kate.   The decor reminds us of a small Bavarian family restaurant which includes family style seating and booths. If you enjoy family style seating you will have a chance to mingle with others while eating or you can wait as we did.  The staff is very friendly and several are of German decent. On Friday and Saturday nights they have a gentleman that plays an accordian who dances and mingles with the customers.  We ordered the wiener schnitzel with the German potato salad and the sauerkraut The schnitzel was lightly breaded and smothered with gravy. This along with the sides was extremely delectable along with the German ale, "dunkel." We also ordered the Sauerbraten, which was delicious as well. Although, the weinerschnitzel was better. Our server gave us an apple wine shot to top off an extraordinary authentic German meal. Thank you so much Zur Kate!!!!! We will be back again.

Who even knew such a good, authentic place existed way out here in the East Valley.  The place has been around for like 20 years.  The decor inside makes you feel like you're in Germany.  The wait staff was very nice and I thought the food was VERY good.  I had the sausage loaf with gravy, cabbage and these unreal home fried potatoes fried with bacon, OMG.  So good.  My date had the bratwurst with sauerkraut and potatoes.  I thought the brats were excellent as well.  They have a nice bar with a lot of German beers.  The price was not bad, 2 dinners, 1 beer was about $24.00.  Also note, their gravy is gluten-free!  Whoot.

My husband and I visited Zur Kate to try something new for my birthday and it was a very pleasant experience. The atmosphere was very cozy and fun. It made us feel like we might actually be visiting a little place in Germany. The waitress was very kind and helpful and the food was good. My favorite part though was the apple strudel! It was delicious.

I went to dinner here yesterday and was very pleased. I had the cordon bleu schnitzel. I told the waiter that I had lived in Germany for two years and I think their German food is better than food in Germany :-). Throw in the accordion player and their furnishings and I was right back in Germany. Loved it!

came  upon the gem that I didn't know was around.  I was more in the mood for pretzels and beer but mostly what they offered was Snitzells or sausages.  Food was good in large portions. Someone was there playing the accordion which helped the ambiance.  Genuine German owners I believe. I would to meet them one day.

We met a couple of friends of ours at Zur Kate for dinner. I was a bit leery due to the fact that Zur Kate is in the same strip mall as the Bavarian Point. My review for the Bavarian Point would have been a zero - due to the roach on the table! So needless to say - I didn't want to go.   We walked in the door and it looked like you just stepped in to someones home in Germany. It's was cute! I little bit Twin Peaks, but cute in an odd way. They had live music and plenty of tasty cold beer! The menu was NOT in German like at the Bavarian Point - Bonus for us Americans. The food was very good I was very impressed. I don't know much about German food so I relied on our friends who go there often.  If you are looking to try something new, like German food! This was a first for me. Head to Zur Kate and know you are going to have a tasty meal!
Like the homey feel along with the ample portions. Came here after a trip to Germany and loved it. Like we were still on vacation  Very friendly staff too and we enjoyed not feeling rushed

I don't often give 5 star reviews, because I feel it should really reflect an exemplary experience, service, or product... at least that's what I really on when checking out reviews for things I haven't yet tried myself.  This charming restaurant checks off all the boxes I mentioned.  Their restaurant exudes a welcoming and comfortable vibe from the moment you step through the door.  Authentic German decor adornments walls, and even the table and chairs take you to a scenic alpine andblakebrute feel at home.  Their is a very talented gentleman playing what I am probably incorrectly calling an accordion in the center of the dining room, and the staff are obviously family who make you feel like you're visiting with that family. Cheerful prompt service with a smile and and eagerness to answer any questions are what you'll find when it comes time to order.  The beer is cold, the food fresh & hot, and you can taste the pride in very bite of your meal that these hospitable and capable restaurateurs put into your dining experience.  Lovely cozy, down to earth ambience with hearty servings.  Everything fresh and rightly done.  I can't praise enough the effort and their success in delivering a truly nostalgic meal, and truly made for a great evening. Can't wait to visit again, and not just for dinner!!.
Yes this is a very good restaurant

This place is amazing. I originally reviewed this place for Check Please AZ, episode 1, 2017 season and loved it then and still love this place.  I'm not expert on German food but this place makes me want to go to Germany. The decor, the friendliness of the staff; warmth just exudes from this place. You feel as if you are in a beer garden at Octoberfest. The wonderful aroma of the food you can't help but become mesmerized in this place. They first serve you homemade marble rye bread which is soft and fresh. Three of us had Warsteiner Dunkel beer is is heavier dark golden beer with lots of flavor. Three of us got the special of the weekend, ham hock. Absolutely delicious, tend fall off the bone perfectly cooked and went so well with the great house mustard that was at the table. The ham hock was large enough for 2 additional meals after we left; all for $14.50. Crazy price for all that food which includes 2 sides. My husband and I both choose the wonderful spaetzle with brown gravy and delicious sweet red cabbage. The cabbage went home with us  because it was such a huge portion. The other two people with us got the Feine Bratwurst which they loved and I tried and it was very good especially with the house mustard. For dessert  we had the apple strudel which had a great flaky crust and wonderful perfectly cooked apples with the right amount of sweetness. another had the cheesecake and loved how creamy that was with a great thick graham cracker crust. So very cheap. 5 of us dined with drinks and dessert for $101.00 without tip. You can't beat it! But get there early and expect to wait for a table. We arrived at 5pm and waited almost a 1/2 hour for a table and they don't take reservations. Worth the wait.

The food is good and from what I can tell is rather authentic. Some things may be bland so consider before ordering. Gravy or onions on schnitzel is recommended. The hashed browns were awesome. Great beers on tap also. Went on a Saturday night, the atmosphere was great with live music and the owners kept buying us rounds of house made apple liquor shots. Will definately be back again.

So we've been here a few times and know that this is a well-loved place for German food. But, there are other choices in the valley and they are all better. The meats are typically quite dried out and lackluster. The fried potatoes are never crispy enough, and the sausages are not any more special than the grocer. The saurkraut or red cabbage sides are actually the hits for me. In our three visits, I have never been made to feel special by the wait staff - they are always in a quick hurry to move you in and out. I get it! It's crowded and beloved by many. Just not by me. Sorry.

Worst food in the world my mother was German and this did not resemble any thing like her German potato salad  this was pure vinegar the Sauerbraten was close 2nd for awful it is suppose to be sweet and sour not just vinegar.. I ask for a cheese hamburger and french-fries the woman said that they don't put anything on the burger well it was so bad that the dog wouldn't eat it...

As best as I can figure out, there are 3 German restaurants in the Phx metro area.  Two of them are in the same parking lot in Mesa.  How does that happen?  So anyway, what about Zur Kate.  Good food but an oddly small menu with no appetizers listed.    As for the restaurant itself its a pretty small place.  Not sure how the busy they get, but if they ever do you could be in for a wait.  Back to the food for a moment.  While it was good, and somewhat German in composition I'm just not sure how authentic it was.  That being said, I could say the same for the other German restaurants here in Phx.  So, not so much of a knock as an observation.
